fields.description:
When a Project has the *Current assignee* or the *Reporter* in the _Assignable User_ Permission, JIRA is allowing users that don't have the _Assignable User_ permission to be assigned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure the Permission Scheme tied to the project has the *Current assignee* (or the *Reporter*) in the _Assignable User_ permission.
!Bug_Screenshot1.png|thumbnail!
 # Create a new issue and set the assignee as a user that does not have the _Assignable User_ Permission.

h3. Actual Results
 * When entering the first letters of any user, this user shows in the user picker list even though this user does not have the permission to be assigned any ticket
!Bug_Screenshot2.png|thumbnail!
 * The issue is created with a user that should not be assignable.

h3. Expected Results

The user should not show up in the Assignee field.
h3. Notes

This appears to only occur during *Issue Creation*. Once an issue has already been created, JIRA will not allow a non-assignable user to be set as the assignee, as shown in the screenshot below:
!Bug_Screenshot3.png|thumbnail!

This can be observed by following these steps:

1. Create a new issue with a non-assignable user per this bug
 2. Change the assignee of the newly created issue to an actual assignable user
 3. Change the assignee back to the same non-assignable user from #1. JIRA will not permit this, and this bug does not occur here.
h3. Workaround

Remove the *Current Assignee* (or the *Reporter*) from the permission
fields.summary: Assignable User Permission allows non-assignable users to be assigned when this permission is granted to the "Reporter" or "Current assignee"

* Large number of users: 40k+
* Start time increases with large number of nodes

Node starts within reasonable time ~4 minutes

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, if there are dashboards available for anonymous users, then they don't see these dashboards when they visit the JIRA url. Ideally, these dashboards should show up under the "Dashboards" menu on the top bar.

As a workaround, the administrators have to share the dashboard link via email or other channels to the users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the dashboards link show all anonymous access dashboards next to the System dashboard.
fields.summary: As a user, I would want to see the link for the anonymous dashboards under Dashboards menu
Searcher for 'Select list' custom field (Severity)

fields.description:
h2. Problem

When you use a javascript on a Text gadget, the scripts actually works fine but when you edit it, JIRA fails to render the script. Therefore, if you accidentally click Save while the HTML field is empty, the javascript will be lost.
h2. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable the Text gadget in Manage Add-ons > System > Atlassian JIRA - Plugins - Gadgets Plugin > Text
 # Go back to the Dashboard and Add the text gadget
 # Add a sample javascript on the HTML field
 # Click Save
 # Edit the Text gadget

h2. Expected Result

The javascript is still visible on the HTML field when you edit the Text gadget
h2. Actual Result

The HTML field is empty. Note that if you accidentally click Save, the javascript will be lost.
fields.summary: Script Failed to be Rendered in Edit Mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63510].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Several methods in {{CommentManager}} interface returns a list of comments. However, no sort order is documented. If user wants to sort, they'll have to do so manually

h3. Suggested Solution
Define a sort for methods in {{CommentManager}}

h3. Why this is important
This would greatly help and reduce time/work in plugin development

h3. Workaround 
Retrieve the list using the method and then manually sort the results
fields.summary: Define sort for methods in CommentManager

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The delete issue link button is hidden until hovered. This causes an issue for screen readers because they're unable to focus on the action. Need to ensure this can be done with the keyboard.

h3. Environment
* Chrome/Safari
* Scree readers eg. VoiceOver 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable VoiceOver in Mac
# Open Safari/Chrome and go to Issue view page
# Try to locate "Delete link" for deleting Issue link using only keyboard

h3. Expected Results
The _delete_ link button able to access/focus with keyboard

h3. Actual Results
The _delete_ link can only be selected if it is mouse hovered
 
h3. Notes
Copied from https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/ACCESS-687
fields.summary: Accessibility: Unable to remove an issue link

fields.description:
h3. Summary
User account from AD is displayed as active in JIRA when it is actually disabled in AD

h3. Environment
Microsoft AD

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 2 OU ( Organizational Unit ) in AD
## OU A - Create a user in this OU
## OU B
# Sync only OU A into JIRA with the user. 
# Ensure that this user has issue history ( set the user as assignee to an issue ) so that the user will be inactive in JIRA when removed
# Disable this User in AD & move this user to OU B which does not sync into JIRA
# Sync the directory - User is now inactive in JIRA 
# Move this User back to OU A  ( User is still disabled in AD ) & sync this directory again in JIRA

h3. Expected Results
User should still remain inactive in JIRA

h3. Actual Results
User is now active in JIRA


h3.Workaround
# Enable the user account in AD 
# Disable the user account in AD 
# Sync the directory in JIRA
# User will now be inactive.
fields.summary: Disabled AD user is active in JIRA after moving OU ( Organizational Unit )
Error returned from JQL query is misleading

  {panel}

Jira Software version: v7.2.6#72008

Steps to reproduce:
 - In Jira Software, navigate to: Administration -> User management -> User Directories
 - Add Directory -> LDAP
 - In the "Configure LDAP User Directory" page, expand the Directory Type

Notice that "FedoraDS" is listed as an option. This should be renamed to "389 Directory Server" or "389DS", if there is a character limit. This is because the project was renamed in 2009: [http://directory.fedoraproject.org/docs/389ds/FAQ/history.html|http://directory.fedoraproject.org/docs/389ds/FAQ/history.html]
fields.summary: FedoraDS in "Configure LDAP User Directory" should be renamed to 389 Directory Server

{noformat}

*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63502].
{panel}
+Issue Summary+

When importing a Cloud backup into JIRA Server, the import would fail with the following error:
{code:java}
2016-12-12 12:03:44,578 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR xxxxx 723x638x1 1b1wxhy 80.193.64.226,172.31.12.212 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error during ActiveObjects restore
com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with <unknown plugin>:Error executing update for SQL statement 'ALTER TABLE PUBLIC.AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANGUAGE ADD CONSTRAINT fk_ao_c7f17e_project_language_project_lang_revision_id FOREIGN KEY (PROJECT_LANG_REVISION_ID) REFERENCES PUBLIC.AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANG_REVISION(ID)'
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.newImportExportSqlException(ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.onSqlException(SqlUtils.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsForeignKeyCreator.create(ActiveObjectsForeignKeyCreator.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ForeignKeyAroundImporter.after(ForeignKeyAroundImporter.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreActiveObjects(DefaultDataImportService.java:554)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:728)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: org.h2.jdbc.JdbcSQLException: Table "AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANG_REVISION" not found; SQL statement:
ALTER TABLE PUBLIC.AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANGUAGE ADD CONSTRAINT fk_ao_c7f17e_project_language_project_lang_revision_id FOREIGN KEY (PROJECT_LANG_REVISION_ID) REFERENCES PUBLIC.AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANG_REVISION(ID) [42102-185]
	at org.h2.message.DbException.getJdbcSQLException(DbException.java:345)
	at org.h2.message.DbException.get(DbException.java:179)
	at org.h2.message.DbException.get(DbException.java:155)
	at org.h2.schema.Schema.getTableOrView(Schema.java:438)
	at org.h2.command.ddl.AlterTableAddConstraint.update(AlterTableAddConstraint.java:72)
	at org.h2.command.CommandContainer.update(CommandContainer.java:78)
	at org.h2.command.Command.executeUpdate(Command.java:254)
	at org.h2.jdbc.JdbcStatement.executeUpdateInternal(JdbcStatement.java:130)
	at org.h2.jdbc.JdbcStatement.executeUpdate(JdbcStatement.java:115)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:34)
	... 18 more
{code}
or
{code:java}
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:PostgreSQL
	- version:9.3.14
	- minor version:3
	- major version:9
Driver:
	- name:PostgreSQL Native Driver
	- version:PostgreSQL 9.1 JDBC4 (build 903)
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "AO_60DB71_SPRINT_pkey"
  Detail: Key ("ID")=(<any numbers>) already exists.
{code}
The error is caused because JIRA is trying to create a plugin table that has a constraint when the table providing the constraint does not exist and does not exist in the exported *_entities.xml_* file from Cloud.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

+Environment+
|Database|H2, MySQL, Oracle and Postgres|

(_though looking at this being a constraint issue, it would likely impact all database types_)

+Expected Behavior+

JIRA would import the data with no issues at all.

+Actual Result+

Import would always fail.

+Workaround+
 # Extract the backup file from JIRA Cloud.
 # Open the file {{activeobjects.xml}} in a text editor
 ** You would need an editor that can edit very large files else it would be truncated.
 # Find and remove the line:
{code:java}
<foreignKey fromTable="AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANGUAGE" fromColumn="PROJECT_LANG_REVISION_ID" toTable="AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANG_REVISION" toColumn="ID" />
{code}

 # Save the file.
 # Zip the entities.xml and activeobjects.xml files back together.
 # Attempt to re-import.
fields.summary: Importing a cloud XML backup to server fails due to table constraint mismatch

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63501].
  {panel}

In enterprise instances, the number of custom fields and field configurations tend to increase rather fast, easily reaching more than a 1000, and JIRA struggles to handle this, especially in maintaining caches and performing permission checking.

There are some improvements that could be made to better scale on this.

h5. Longer persistence of caching
Populating caches is expensive, as it locks out multiple operations that depend on it. Currently, most of our field caches expire every 30 minutes.

h5. Expensive permission checking

h5. High memory usage
fields.summary: Better scaling of Custom Fields and Field Configurations

Currently in JIRA, there will be only 5 issues listed in in the issue linked list. Users would like options to permanently list all the issues linked to the specific issue.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it's only possible for each user to set "MY JIRA HOME" by him/herself after login to JIRA, JIRA administrator cannot change this setting for other users nor set a default home page for all the new users.

h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Problem Definition
There is currently no way to automatically add an application e.g. Confluence to use JIRA as a user server.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63492].
  {panel}

h2. Problem

After import from JIRA Server to Cloud, users cannot login into Cloud instance.

h2. Message: 
+No error is displayed on screen+ Users simply can't access the site

h2. Steps to reproduce
# perform a JIRA import

h2. Expected
Import is successful an users can login

h2.  Result
Import appears to be successful but administrator is logged out and no user can login. Not even sysadmin.
The jira database shows the imported users but they are not in the crowd directory that syncs Cloud applications.
The Crowd db directory is not present in the JIRA DB.


h3. Verification:
Support can run the following query to detect if the site is affected.
{code}
jira_560571=> select * from cwd_directory;
 id |     directory_name      |  lower_directory_name   |      created_date      |      updated_date      | active |           description           |                   impl_class                    |    
            lower_impl_class                 | directory_type | directory_position 
----+-------------------------+-------------------------+------------------------+------------------------+--------+---------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+----
---------------------------------------------+----------------+--------------------
  1 | JIRA Internal Directory | jira internal directory | 2013-02-28 09:57:51+00 | 2013-02-28 09:57:51+00 |      1 | JIRA default internal directory | com.atlassian.crowd.directory.InternalDirectory | com
.atlassian.crowd.directory.internaldirectory | INTERNAL       |                  0
(1 row)
{code}
There should also appear a Crowd directory that links with the user base in Cloud.

h3. Notes
If a yellow "failed import" message is shown, then it is a different problem. The crowd_directory is also not created when the import fails. This problem is for the import successfully importing JIRA but failing to create the crowd_directory.

h3. Workaround
Support can investigate if the directory can be added manually to fix the problem. Please contact [Cloud Support|https://support.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Import doesn't sync user directories and users can't access JIRA

h3. Summary
Screen scheme audit logging is not captured as per our [Audit Log documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Auditing+in+JIRA+applications] when a project has multiple screen schemes associated with it,

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any project which has multiple Screen schemes
# Assign a different screen scheme than what is already assigned.
# Go to System > Audit Log and try finding the change.
# 
h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results
No entry appears

h3.Workaround
There is no known workaround for this.
fields.summary: No Screen Scheme Audit Logging for Projects with Multiple Screen Schemes

fields.description:
h3. Summary

I create multiple issues using the "Create issue" screen with the "Create another" option enabled. I enter the "Sprint" information to an active sprint and I receive a warning that the scope will be affected, which is correct. After creating the issue, I enter information for the next issue and I remove the "Sprint" value to leave it empty. I still receive the same warning... I'm also able to receive the warning if I set a future sprint.
h3. Environment

JIRA 7.1.9
 JIRA 7.2.6
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on the *Create* button to open the "Create issue" screen in a pop-up
 # For the Sprint field, select a Active Sprint
 # Check the "Create another" option
 # For the next issue, select a Future sprint or leave the Sprint field empty

h3. Expected Results

When creating the second issue, the "Sprint scope will be affected by this action" message will disappear, as an Active sprint is not selected
h3. Actual Results

The "Sprint scope will be affected by this action" message will not be cleared at any time.
h3. Workaround

Do not use the "Create another option". This will close the pop-up window and clear the message.
fields.summary: "Sprint scope will be affected by this action" message will not disappear without closing the "Create issue" screen

fields.description:
h3. +*Summary*+

Project sidebar "Version" option is missing from Business projects, even if version has been added
h3. +*Environment*+

JIRA Core 7.2.2 (Customer's environment)
 JIRA Core 7.3.6 (Support verified latest version also affected)
h3. +*Steps to Reproduce*+
 # Create a Business type project.
 # Navigate to Project Settings > Versions > Add some new versions.
 # Verify the Project Sidebar.

h3. +*Expected Results*+

Version option should be available after added some versions to the project.
h3. +*Actual Results*+

Version option is missing, it does not get created, although issues can still "see" and use the versions created.
h3. +*Notes*+

Support tested on JIRA 7.1.x and able to see Version option on the project sidebar after adding some versions. This seems to be affecting JIRA Core 7.2.x only (7.3.6 more recently). 

And also, 7.2 and 7.3 documentation also mention the Version option should be available.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver072/viewing-a-project-829092478.html]

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver073/viewing-a-project-861255675.html]
h3. +*Workaround*+

As administrator: navigate to Versions via Project Settings instead of the sidebar.
fields.summary: Project sidebar "Version" option is missing from Business projects, even if version has been added

h2. *Current Behaviour*

JIRA users are unable to authenticate with JIRA Capture using the
same authentication mechanisms as JIRA. Alternatives for GApps users
are cumbersome to the point of being unmaintainable.

Users should be able to authenticate via the same mechanisms in
both applications. Specifically, they should be able to authenticate
via GApps in JIRA Capture. Similarly to the way that JIRA with GApps currently behaves, pretty
sure there is available tooling for extensions to do GApps auth.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce:
# Integrate JIRA with Apache following the guide:
#- [Integrating JIRA with Apache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache]
# An example of {{server.xml}}
{code:xml}
<Connector acceptCount="100" connectionTimeout="20000" disableUploadTimeout="true" enableLookups="false" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" port="8766" protocol="HTTP/1.1" proxyName="testing.com" proxyPort="80" redirectPort="8443" useBodyEncodingForURI="true"/>
{code}
{code:xml}
        <Engine defaultHost="localhost" name="Catalina">
            <Host appBase="webapps" autoDeploy="true" name="localhost" unpackWARs="true">

                <Context docBase="${catalina.home}/atlassian-jira" path="/jira" reloadable="false" useHttpOnly="true">
{code}
# With the configuration on Apache Proxy side:
{code}
<VirtualHost *:80>
    ServerName testing.com
    
    <Proxy *>
            Order deny,allow
            Allow from all
    </Proxy>

    ProxyRequests           Off
    ProxyPreserveHost       On
    ProxyPass               /jira       http://localhost:8766/jira
    ProxyPassReverse        /jira       http://localhost:8766/jira
</VirtualHost>
{code}
# Start JIRA and restart Apache.
# Access JIRA through http://localhost:8766/jira

h3. Expected Result:
As mentioned in the documentation:
bq. If the context path is other than empty or root (/), e.g. /jira , visiting JIRA via the proxy connector (e.g. http://jiraserver:8080/jira) should redirect you to the configured proxy (e.g. https://jira.atlassian.com/jira). 
Accessing through the context path will redirect it to the FQDN.

h3. Actual Result:
It will show as mentioned in the documentation where:
bq. If the context path is empty or root (/), visiting JIRA via the proxy connector (e.g.  http://jiraserver:8080/) should take you to JIRA with a warning:
fields.summary: Proxy Redirection still did not work even with Context Path

h3. Summary
JQL function componentsLeadByUser() takes time proportional to number of projects cubed.

h3. Expected behaviour

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
When editing a large workflow with several steps, It takes much longer to load the page and Consequently triggers a *Script* error. However, no errors are triggered in the logs. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to *Workflows*
# Locate a complex/large workflow 
# Click on *Edit*

h3. Expected Results
The workflow loads fine and in optimal/acceptable time without errors. 

h3. Actual Results 
The workflow takes much longer and triggers browser specific *script* errors.

For Example: 

*Firefox version 47.0*:
 !firefox-unresponsive script.png|thumbnail! 

*Internet Explorer Version 11.447.14393.0*:
 !IE-ScriptError.jpg|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
h6. Option 1: 
Click on "Stop Script" 

h6. Option 2:
* For Firefox, follow the instructions in this document -> [Warning Unresponsive script - What it means and how to fix it|https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/warning-unresponsive-script]
* For IE, follow the instructions in this document -> [How to troubleshoot script errors in Internet Explorer|https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/kb/308260#bookmark-cause]
fields.summary: Edit Workflow performance slow on Internet Explorer and Firefox. Triggers Script error

*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63438].
{panel}
h1. Problem

The 'Save' button in the form to enter a comment has a keyboard shortcut for submitting the form, which on Mac+Chrome is *Ctrl+Alt+s*. With the new Visual mode editor for comments, the keyboard shortcut does nothing.

Note: -I have not tested this against other OS/browser combinations.-

Update: We have verified that the issue also occurs in Windows+Google Chrome 62 (the shortcut there is Alt+s)
h1. Steps to reproduce
 # Create/view an issue, press the Comment button
 # Enter a comment and use the keyboard shortcut to submit the form while having the Visual tab selected.

h2. Expected

A comment is added as a result of step one and another comment is added as a result of step 2.
h2. Actual

Only using the Comment button works. The shortcut does not seem to work at all (neither Alt+e for Internal comment nor Alt+s for regular comment in SD projects)
h1. Work around

Any of these should work:
* Switch to Text mode in the form (in SD Projects this does not fix the Alt+e command, only the Alt+s)
* Manually submit the form with the mouse
* Ctrl/Command + Enter (in SD projects this makes the comment Internal).
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut for submitting a comment does not work when the text input is in Visual Mode

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63427].
  {panel}

The attached screenshot shows the "Create" transition of any issue in JIRA workflows. Unfortunately there are two ways to reach that same transition from the JIRA UI:
1. An issue is being created using the "Create" button
2. An issue is being created using the More->Clone menu item of another issue

In my workflow, these two cases require significantly different handling. Specifically, my users like to use (2) instead of (1)

And in fact often they even prefer to clone an issue in the wrong project then move it to the right project instead of just using the "Create" button in the right project.

 

This known behavior was ok before one of our web hook integrations was built for two way sync of bugs, but it became catastrophic afterward. The classic error was to clone an issue to create a completely unrelated issue in a project that is not even tracked by this process. The result was a bunch of dangling bugs in the other application created "by mistake" because someone decided to "clone+move" instead of "create".

So I need two separate transitions, one for create and a different one for clone, in order to track the different set of actions that I need to take in one case or the other. Right now that can be done with undocumented code in Scriptrunner (so undocumented that I've never even got a straight answer from Jamie Echlin: [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/9863448/answers/38752668] ). Here's the code I'm using:

if(issue.key == null)

\{ // If the issue is not a clone, we honor whatever issuetype that // was set at issue creation screen return }

else

\{ // The issue is a clone. A few fields need to be purged here, because // purging them in normal post-functions would clear them even if they // had been explicitly set during the create screen of a new bug.  }

While this looks pretty simple, being completely undocumented means that every time the support team upgrades JIRA or the scriptrunner plugin, this might break.

The other, more annoying side effect is that once this logic is in play, any custom field that needs to be managed during this transition will need to be inside this same script, and I lose all the advantages of the JIRA UI managing post functions.

Specifically, in my bug workflow, when an issue is being cloned (but not when an issue is being created anew) I need to:
 - Change the issuetype to "Bug" for clones to avoid unnecessary triggers
 - Purge 4 custom fields

These custom fields cannot be purged on a "Create new" (as opposed to "Create clone") because they are present in the editor when an issue is created, and the user could decide to explicitly set them to something at creation time (same deal of the Issuetype "bug (public)").
fields.summary: Separate "Create new" and "Create as clone" transitions in workflows

JIRA protects access to its administrative functions by requiring a secure administration session in order to use the JIRA administration screens, which is known as websudo.) Summary

Pie Chart Gadget does not allow any data-interpretation configuration.

It would be good if one could customise the gadget's outcome; for instance - by specifying which subset of attributes (i.e.: labels) should be calculated and presented on Pie Chart.
h5. Steps to reproduce:
 # Add labels for multiple issues. For example, Issue A was labelled *TESTA*, *TESTB*, *TESTC*, *TESTD*, *TESTE* and Issue B was labelled *TESTA*, *TESTB*, *TESTC*.
 # Go to issue navigator and save the filter with *labels in (TESTA, TESTB, TESTC)*
 # Go to dashboard and create Pie Chart with the saved filter.
 # Pie Chart will display labels *TESTA*, *TESTB*, *TESTC*, *TESTD*, *TESTE*.
 !Capture 2016-12-03 at 10.46.45.png|thumbnail!
 # This happens because Issue A is labelled *TESTD*, *TESTE*.

h5. Environment

JIRA 6.4.14, JIRA 7.2.5
h5. Expected Results

JIRA only display labels specified in the gadget's configuration
h5. Notes

Limiting the presented data to a custom-specified subset bares a high risk of data mis-interpretation. Rendered charts SHOULD in a discrete but clearly visible way NOTIFY the end user that presented data is limited to a pre-defined SUBSET. 
h3.
fields.summary: Pie Chart Gadget should allow limiting the scope of displayed data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63400].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
It would be helpful with JQL to be able to search for issues by comparing user fields to other user fields (e.g. where Assignee == Reporter   or where Reporter == Requested Participants (on service desk))


h3. Suggested Solution
Currently this is not possible to do with JQL, as you cannot compare user fields against other user fields.   All user field can be compared with is a text value.  As for functions, only {{CurrentUser()}} and {{memberOf()}} functions can be used for this, neither of which can make these kinds of comparisons.


h3. Why this is important
This can be very useful from a JIRA admin point of view in order to be able to find issues that meet certain user criteria.  For example, when the assignee is also the reporter, or when one of the user fields matches a user in a custom user field.   This kind of comparison should be relatively easy to implement within JQL and in turn could extend the functionality significantly.

 
h3. Workaround 
This is something that can be done with [Scriptrunner|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner/server/overview].  Only then can you gain access to other JQL functions such as {code:borderStyle=solid}
issuefunction in expression("project = FOO", "assignee != reporter") 
{code}


Examples of users on [Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/] looking for this functionality:
* [Help with JQL assignee != reporter - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/4981880/help-with-jql-assignee-reporter]
* [JQL Scripted Function to check if assignee = reporter? - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/200713/jql-scripted-function-to-check-if-assignee-reporter]
* [Is it possible to search for issues where assignee=reporter? - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/318999/is-it-possible-to-search-for-issues-where-assignee-reporter]
* [Assignee not same as reporter - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/250557/assignee-not-same-as-reporter]
* [JQL Query for searching issues that are assigned to the reporter - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/91037/jql-query-for-searching-issues-that-are-assigned-to-the-reporter]
* [JQL: query issues where assignee != project lead; or where assignee != reporter - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/64387/jql-query-issues-where-assignee-project-lead-or-where-assignee-reporter]
fields.summary: Add JQL function to allow the comparison of user fields to each other

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When cloning an issue with Time Tracking data, the time remaining/estimated is copied incorrectly.

h3. Environment

* JIRA 7.1.9

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new story with an 8 hour estimation.
# Log 1 hour of time on story.
# Create a sub task off of that issue with 2 hour estimation.
# Log 1 hour on that sub task.
# Check total estimated time on original story is 1d2h (assuming the default 8 hour workday).
# Remaining time on original story is 1d (1d2h -1h -1h).
# Now clone the Story, you will see remaining time as 2d, with and estimated time of 1d 2h.

h3. Expected Results

Either it will not clone the time at all, as documented (see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34366 and https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-60361), or that the remaining time will stay consistent.

h3. Actual Results

The remaining time is set to an incorrect value, that can exceed the estimated time.
fields.summary: Clone Issue Copies Time Tracking Incorrectly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63396].
  {panel}

If an issue that has story points is closed without being assigned to a sprint, those story points will never appear in any burndown chart.

It would be very nice if the user was presented with a confirmation dialog when trying to close an issue that has story points but that has not been assigned to a sprint.

This could either be a basic "This issue has story points but has not been assigned to a sprint. Proceed? OK/Cancel" dialog, or a more complex "... Assign this issue to the current sprint before closing? Yes/No" dialog that would assign the issue to the current sprint before closing it if the user chooses "yes".

People make mistakes. This would help them avoid doing so, and train them to assign the issue to the current sprint before attempting to close it.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Closing an issue that is not assigned to a sprint should pop a confirmation dialog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If we import the data in to such field through JIM using CSV with value set to string "None" then we see a duplicate entry "None" in the drop down list. This causes confusion for the uses as they would see duplicate value in the field.

h3. Environment
* JIRA version 7.0.10
* JIRA version 7.2.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field with Select List (single choice) custom field with few options such as *design, code and configuration*. The custom field will have a None value in default
# Perform a CSV import to import data into this field with None to make it as default value if we did not have any choice in the custom field
# Duplicated None is created in the custom field

h3. Expected Results
CSV import is completed without creation of duplicate *None* value for Select List (single choice) custom field

h3. Actual Results

Duplicated value is created in the custom field as shown in the image below.
!duplicate.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Leave the value for custom field empty in CSV file to avoid duplicate value from being created
fields.summary: Duplicate 'None' value for Select List (single choice) custom filed
